Detailed Description

Façade for interacting with the Rdio API.

Supports server API calls and track playback for anonymous and authorized users.

Member Function Documentation

- (void) authorizeFromController: (UIViewController *)  currentController

Presents a modal login dialog and attempts to get an authorized Rdio user.

Parameters:
currentControllerController from which the login view should be launched
- (void) authorizeUsingAccessToken: (NSString *)  accessToken
fromController: (UIViewController *)  currentController 

Attempts to reauthorize using an access token from a previous session.

If this process fails the user is presented with a modal login dialog.

Parameters:
accessTokenA token received from a previous rdioDidAuthorizeUser:withAccessToken: delegate call
currentControllerController from which a login view might be launched
- (RDAPIRequest *) callAPIMethod: (NSString *)  method
withParameters: (NSDictionary *)  params
delegate: (id< RDAPIRequestDelegate >)  delegate 

Calls an Rdio Web Service API method with the given parameters.

Parameters:
methodName of the method to call. See http://developer.rdio.com/docs/read/rest/Methods for available methods.
paramsA dictionary of parameters as required for the method
delegateAn object implementing the RDAPIRequestDelegate protocol or an instance of the RDAPIRequestDelegate class, to be notified on request complete.
- (id) initWithConsumerKey: (NSString *)  key
andSecret: (NSString *)  secret
delegate: (id< RdioDelegate >)  delegate 

Initializes the Rdio API with your consumer key and secret.

Visit http://developer.rdio.com/ to register and apply for a key.

Parameters:
keyYour consumer key
secretYour secret
delegateDelegate for receiving state changes, or nil
- (void) logout

Logs out the current user.

Calls rdioDidLogout on delegate on completion. Clients are responsible for clearing any application-persisted state (user data, access token, etc).

Property Documentation

- (NSDictionary*) user [read, assign]

A dictionary describing the current user, or nil if no user is logged in.

See http://developer.rdio.com/docs/read/rest/types
